definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: North Korea has really boxed them in.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮真的是讓他們犯難。

sentences.english: He has entertained the world with stories of a daring2 archeologist.
sentences.chinese: 他以一位敢於冒險犯難的考古學家的故事娛樂全世界。

sentences.english: Youth means the predominance of courage over timidity, of adventure over the love of ease.
sentences.chinese: 青春意味着勇氣勝過膽怯，冒險犯難勝過貪圖安逸。

sentences.english: He was torn between his duty and his better instincts.
sentences.chinese: 他在選擇盡職責和憑直覺更應當怎麼做之間犯難了。

sentences.english: Outside of China, even staff have trouble pronouncing its name.
sentences.chinese: 在中國以外，工作人員甚至爲公司名稱的發音犯難。

definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
